channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: HUGE pothole, very dangerous on dual carriageway, 22nd August
item.description:
Left hand side of the road, soon after dual carriageway begins, travelling from Coombe Hill towards Tewkesbury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury

item.title: Potholes and cracks opening up down the entire length of lane, 22nd August
item.description:
Wide cracks are opening up the entire length of the lane. The road is subsiding all the way down and is becoming hazardous to drive and cycle down. The issue has been worsening over a number of years and recent repairs have failed to address the problem. Damage to vehicles is likely

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The new cycle path here is shared, however I have personally nearly been knocked over by cyclists at high speed travelling on the inside of the pavement. The exit for pedestrians from Sandycroft Road is blind and the cyclist have no view of pedestrians to warn them with a bell. Can it please be possible to put a small sign on the pavement to indicate pedestrians to use the inner part of the pavement and cyclists the outer by the road like the rest of the cycle path. I feel that this is an accident waiting to happen. I am one of the few that actually agree with the implementation of the cycle path but this particular part is very dangerous., 22nd August
item.description:
Pedestrian path exiting Sandycroft Road to join the pavement at Cheltenham Road East.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sandycroft Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: A st Georges Cross has been painted over the mini roundabout and on the approach chevronss, 22nd August
item.description:
Mini roundabout at the junction of The Park and Moorend Park Road. This type of Politically based graffiti must be removed ASAP or it will spread throughout the County.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Overgrown footpath, 22nd August
item.description:
Meads Alley to Parton road public path neglected, nettles and brambles - the path is greatly in need of attention especially as school children and parents and elderly use this path, please can it be given attention before the return to school on 3 September 2025 - many thanks most grateful

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
